verses.plain: Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

tokens.t: Praise ye the
. O give thanks unto the
; for
good: for his mercy
for ever.

verses.plain: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can shew forth all his praise?

tokens.t: Who can utter the mighty acts of the
can shew forth all his praise?

verses.plain: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

tokens.t: Blessed
they that keep judgment,
he that doeth righteousness at all times.

verses.plain: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

tokens.t: Remember me, O
, with the favour
thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

verses.plain: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

tokens.t: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

verses.plain: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

tokens.t: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

verses.plain: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

tokens.t: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked
at the sea,
at the Red sea.

verses.plain: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

tokens.t: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

verses.plain: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

tokens.t: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

verses.plain: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

tokens.t: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated
, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.plain: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

tokens.t: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

verses.plain: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

tokens.t: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

verses.plain: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

tokens.t: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

verses.plain: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

tokens.t: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

verses.plain: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

tokens.t: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

verses.plain: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.

tokens.t: They envied Moses also in the camp,
Aaron the saint of the

verses.plain: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

tokens.t: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

verses.plain: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

tokens.t: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

verses.plain: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

tokens.t: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

verses.plain: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

tokens.t: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

verses.plain: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

tokens.t: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

verses.plain: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

tokens.t: Wondrous works in the land of Ham,
terrible things by the Red sea.

verses.plain: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

tokens.t: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy

verses.plain: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

tokens.t: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

verses.plain: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.

tokens.t: But murmured in their tents,
hearkened not unto the voice of the

verses.plain: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

tokens.t: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

verses.plain: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

tokens.t: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

verses.plain: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

tokens.t: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

verses.plain: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

tokens.t: Thus they provoked
to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

verses.plain: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

tokens.t: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and
the plague was stayed.

verses.plain: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

tokens.t: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

verses.plain: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

tokens.t: They angered
also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

verses.plain: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

tokens.t: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

verses.plain: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:

tokens.t: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the
commanded them:

verses.plain: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

tokens.t: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

verses.plain: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

tokens.t: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

verses.plain: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

tokens.t: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

verses.plain: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

tokens.t: And shed innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

verses.plain: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

tokens.t: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

verses.plain: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

tokens.t: Therefore was the wrath of the
kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

verses.plain: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

tokens.t: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

verses.plain: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

tokens.t: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

verses.plain: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

tokens.t: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked
with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

verses.plain: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

tokens.t: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

verses.plain: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

tokens.t: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

verses.plain: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

tokens.t: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

verses.plain: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

tokens.t: Save us, O
our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name,
to triumph in thy praise.

verses.plain: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.

tokens.t: Blessed
the
God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the

footnotes.text: They soon…: Heb. They made haste, they forgat
the pleasant…: Heb. a land of desire
to overthrow: Heb. to make them fall
To overthrow: Heb. To make them fall
